title: 115_hr2863
content: The Act may be cited as the "Land and National Park Deferred Maintenance Act" or the "LAND Act". The Land and National Park Deferred Maintenance Act, also known as the LAND Act, is amended to extend reauthorization and funding until September 30, 2024. $450,000,000 in funding will be available annually without further appropriation or fiscal year limitation. The Land and National Park Deferred Maintenance Act, known as the LAND Act, is amended to extend reauthorization and funding until September 30, 2024. $450,000,000 in annual funding is available without further appropriation or fiscal year limitation. The Fund's purposes and allocation of funds are specified, with $180,000,000 designated for Federal purposes under section 200306. The LAND Act is amended to extend funding until 2024 with $180,000,000 allocated for Federal purposes under section 200306. An additional $220,000,000 is designated for various programs, with remaining funds used for specified activities. The President must provide detailed allocations for funds in the annual budget submission to Congress. No funds can be used for eminent domain. A minimum of 1.5% of funds must be allocated for projects securing recreational public access to Federal land. In title 54, United States Code, there are conforming amendments related to appropriations and expenditures. Amendments include inserting "or otherwise expended" after "Congress" in section 200302, adding "or expenditures" after "appropriations" in section 200304, and inserting "expenditures" after "appropriations" in section 200305. In title 54, United States Code, there are conforming amendments related to appropriations and expenditures. Section 200306 is amended to include "expenditure" after "appropriation" and "expenditures" after "appropriations" each time it appears. Subsection (b) is also amended to include "or expenditures" after "Appropriations" each time it appears. The table of sections for chapter 2003 of title 54, United States Code, is amended by striking the item relating to section 200303 and inserting the following. SEC. 3. NATIONAL PARK SERVICE MAINTENANCE AND REVITALIZATION CONSERVATION FUND. The "National Park Service and Related Agencies Maintenance and Revitalization Conservation Fund" is established in the Treasury with $450,000,000 available annually from 2018 to 2024 for conservation purposes. Funds come from mineral revenues, and cannot be used for land acquisition. The Secretary of the Interior administers the funds each year. The Secretary of the Interior allocates $25,000,000 for the Fish and Wildlife Service, $25,000,000 for the Bureau of Land Management, and $375,000,000 for the National Park Service for high priority deferred maintenance needs. The Secretary of Agriculture allocates $25,000,000 for the Forest Service for similar needs. SEC. 4. OFFSET. Congress believes that the costs of implementing this Act should be balanced.
